definition: "house on a cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 53), occurring in 店, 序, 底 etc
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: I can speak Shanghai dialect other than Cantoness.
sentences.chinese: 除了广东话，我还能讲上海话。

sentences.english: I speak the Shanghai dialect, Szechwan dialect, Cantonese and, of course, Mandarin.
sentences.chinese: 我会讲上海话，四川话，广东话和国语。

sentences.english: I can speak the Shanghaiese and Cantonese.
sentences.chinese: 我可以讲上海话和广东话。

sentences.english: Kriya: Could you please specify what language you would prefer: Cantonese, or Mandarin?
sentences.chinese: 你需要官话就是普通话还是广东话的打给你？

sentences.english: Click to see the Ambassador offer a personal greeting in Cantonese and Taishanese.
sentences.chinese: 点击观看大使亲自说的广东话和台山话问候。

sentences.english: These crowds shouted "running dogs" in Cantonese at those championing democracy.
sentences.chinese: 人们用广东话对那些带头的民主派们高喊“走狗”。

sentences.english: Hooi-yee is fluent in Mandarin and a few other dialects.
sentences.chinese: 能说流利的广东话和普通话，以及简单的方言。

sentences.english: She has been teaching Cantonese in Chinese School for more than four years.
sentences.chinese: 在中华学校教授广东话经已四年。

sentences.english: I did not know Cantonese at all and knew Mandarin only a little.
sentences.chinese: 广东话我一窍不通，中文也只识得少许。

sentences.english: It was not a law that simply said "Let's all speak Cantonese".
sentences.chinese: 没有这样一部法律简单的说“让我们都说广东话”。

sentences.english: I speak English, Mandarin and Cantonese.
sentences.chinese: 我能说英语，普通语和广东话。

definition: Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
Taishanese, a language of the Yue language group 粵語|粤语[Yue4 yu3] spoken in Jiangmen 江門|江门[Jiang1 men2] and in the Chinatowns of North America

Chinese language (Mandarin), emphasizing its national nature/Chinese as a primary or secondary school subject/Chinese in the context of the Nationalist Government/Guoyu, book of historical narrative c. 10th-5th century BC
Cantonese romanization/Jyutping, one of the many Cantonese romanization systems
